summary: This memo contains notes for Mr. McCone from October 1, 1963, covering topics such as General Chiang Ching-kuo's visit to the U.S., a proposal to send Dr. Cavanagh to Rome, an assessment of the reliability of Penkovskiy's documentary material, a briefing on the program against Cuba, congressional debates on the test ban treaty, a recommendation on the Agency's standing in Congress, efforts to obtain a replacement for Colonel Grogan, a briefing on the Agency's covert action programs, a meeting about personnel security, and a letter confirming Frank Hand's assignment.
title: NOTES FOR MR. McCONE
